title: Rugby World Cup 2019 referees: Jonathan Kaplan's verdict on Nigel Owens and Jerome Garces ahead of semi-finals
text:
Nigel Owens, England v New Zealand

Nigel is the pre-eminent referee of his era. That is borne out not just by the fact that he has done more Tests than anyone else, but by the fact that he generally produces better spectacles more often than anyone else.

He has a philosophy of how he likes the game to be played and has been able to merge that outlook with the ability to make quick and accurate decisions within the framework of the law.

That in itself is risky and requires a special skill set. I think he may have slipped off the top in some people’s eyes in terms of accuracy but I rate him in the top few and he has performed well in this tournament.​​

What does he like?​

A good spectacle. Ensuring...
description: Nigel Owens, England v New Zealand
